A method for extracting pure water from sea water for emergency supply of shipwrecked victims at sea comprising the steps of forming an osmotic membrane in the shape of a spherical body said body being made of common glass and capable of withstanding a hydrostatic pressure in excess of 360 pounds per square inch, submerging said body to a minimum depth of at least 827 feet in the ocean, maintaining said body clear of the ocean bottom and washing its surface with the ocean currents to remove any foreign matter accumulated on said bodys external surface, use the ocean pressure to exert a differenti-al pressure between the interior and exterior of said
